intro: Lippia micromera, commonly known as dwarf lippia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of tiny white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, often reaching heights of less than 30 centimeters. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties. Lippia micromera is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to various soil conditions.
